statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 3 \\ -9 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -7 \\ -3 \\ 6 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 3 \\ -9 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -7 \\ -3 \\ 6 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
